1.text: Place an upside-down baking sheet in the oven and turn the oven to 500 °F (260 °C).

2.text: Mix the flour, salt, olive oil, and water in a bowl.

3.text: Knead the matzo dough for 4 to 5 minutes.

4.text: Divide the dough into 4 pieces and roll each as thin as possible.

5.text: Poke the surface of the matzos with a fork and brush them with oil if you like.

6.text: Lay 1 or 2 matzos on the hot baking sheet.

7.text: Bake the matzos for 3 to 4 minutes and flip them halfway through the baking time.

8.text: Cool the matzos on a rack and store them at room temperature for up to 1 week.

9.text: Combine whole-wheat flour, salt, and oil in a bowl.

10.text: Mix in 1 cup (240 ml) of the water to form a soft dough.

11.text: Knead the roti dough for 10 minutes.

12.text: Cover the dough and let it rest at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes.

13.text: Heat a skillet or tawa over medium heat.

14.text: Divide the dough into 12 pieces and roll each piece into a ball.

15.text: Roll each ball into a 6 to 8 in (15 to 20 cm) circle.

16.text: Place 1 circle in the skillet and cook it for 1 minute.

17.text: Flip the roti over and cook it for 1 more minute.

18.text: Brush the roti with melted butter or ghee.
